fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41067].
  {panel}

If you are using version 5.8.16 or 5.8.17, or have used those versions in the past without running a script to fix the affected attachments, then you are likely affected by CONF-39975. Please see that ticket instead.

In some cases, it is legitimate for the message "Unknown attachment" to appear. For example:

* If you upload an attachment to a page and then delete it from the attachments list without removing the macro which references it, the macro will show "Unknown attachment".
* If you upload an attachment on Page-A and then reference it in a macro on Page-B, then delete the original Page-A, then the attachment will also be deleted. This causes the Page-B macro to display "Unknown attachment"

If you observed "unknown attachment" after one of these scenarios, this is not a bug, but rather expected behaviour.

If you observed "unknown attachment" by any other scenario, it is likely a bug. If you find a way to reproduce this issue, please let us know by commenting below, with details of how to reproduce the issue and your version of confluence. If you observe something different than an "unknown attachment" message but attachments do fail to download, please let us know exactly what you see. If you observe this issue but are not on and have never been on Confluence 5.8.16 or 5.8.17, please let us know below.

If you observe this issue you may try resolving the broken attachments using the same instructions outlined in CONF-39975 - let us know if it works or not for you.

h3. Problem Definition
Currently files can be attached into Confluence, but have be manually reattached with newer versions.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow ability to embed a remote file that gets updated daily and Confluence reflects the most up to date changes.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41051].
  {panel}

On trying to reset my password, I receive an e-mail that contains a password reset link.
Clicked the link, entered a new password, then the system said “user account ‘stanaka’ doesn’t exist the system”.

So I tried to create a new account, although I knew the account already existed.
The system returns a message “this account already exists”.

It seems the process goes on in a loop, there is no way to reset the password.
I wonder if two accounts are registered for my e-mail address: “stanaka” and “sachiko tanaka”.

After repeating the attempt, the system eventually threw a fatal error. Please see screenshots.
fields.summary: Unable to reset my password

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41050].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Previous Versions of Attachments uploaded to Confluence that contain a Special Character in their Title cannot be downloaded and generates a "Page Not Found" error

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.10 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload an attachment to a Confluence Page which contains a Special Character; for testing, used a Plus '+' character
# Modify the file and re-upload it to the same Confluence Page to generate a version
# Go to the Page's Attachments and click on a Previous Version (say Version 1) to download the previous version

h3. Expected Results
Previous version of the file prompts for download 

h3. Actual Results
Page opens in error and indicates "Page Not Found"
No Errors in log

h3. Notes
All versions under the parent (including the "Current") cannot be downloaded from the expanded view showing all versions however the titled Attachment (title of attachment) can be clicked on and downloaded without issues. 
!AttachmentVersions.png|thumbnail!

Unsure of other special characters which may affect this; have only tested with + 

h3.Workaround
Found that the URL displays the following:
{{https://HOSTNAME/wiki/download/attachments/2654266/Example%20Sheet%20%2B.xlsx?version=1&modificationDate=1457999001396&api=v2}}

After URL manipulation, found that the {{&modificationDate=1457999001396&}} section appears to break the URL. 

If it is removed and replaced with a Single Ampersand '&', the previous version file can be downloaded successfully: 

{{https://HOSTNAME/wiki/download/attachments/2654266/Example%20Sheet%20%2B.xlsx?version=1&api=v2}}
fields.summary: Unable to Download Previous Versions of Attachments Which Contain Special Characters in Title
Allow blueprint to consume template created through the administration page
Team Calendar: Show sprint issue assignees

fields.description:
This is a bug in a JIRA-Confluence federated setup, both installed behind a reverse proxy.
Confluence knows both the public and private url of JIRA, as declared in application links.
(Capture3.jpg)
However, it seems the private url is used for icon display when using single JIRA issue macro. (Capture1.jpg and Capture2.jpg)

The good url is used in the link however, and the JIRA issue can be accessed through the link.
The icon appears properly in multi issue display mode (Capture4.jpg)
fields.summary: Broken link to icon in JIRA macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
One of the customer is reporting an issue related to week number being wrong when implementing a user macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Create an user macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/writing-user-macros-4485.html] with the following content:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
## Macro title: My Macro
## Macro has a body: Y or N
## Body processing: Selected body processing option
## Output: Selected output option
##
## Developed by: My Name
## Date created: dd/mm/yyyy
## Installed by: My Name

## This is an example macro
## @param Name:title=Name|type=string|required=true|desc=Your name
## @param Colour:title=Favourite Colour|type=enum|enumValues=red,green,blue|default=red|desc=Choose your favourite colour

#set($calendar = $action.dateFormatter.calendar)
#set($week= $calendar.get(3)) #* 3rd field of constants = WEEK_OF_YEAR *#
$week
$calendar
{code}
# Embed the newly created macro on a Confluence page

h4. Expected results
The correct week number is displayed, for example on March 14th, 2016 it should be *11*.

h4. Actual results
The week number displayed is higher than the expected, for March 14th, 2016 it displays 12.

The above is caused by the {{minimalDaysInFirstWeek}} setting derived is set to {{1}} instead of {{4}}, which makes the first truncated week to be counted.

h3.Workaround
Updating *JAVA_OPTS* (Confluence 5.5 and earlier or CATALINA_OPTS 5.6 or later) variable in {{<confluence-install>/bin/setenv.sh}} with adding the following options: {{-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=GB -Duser.variant=GB}} .
fields.summary: Wrong week number in user macros
Ability to modify page layout with Connect

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Link in JIRA Chart (Two dimensional) is incorrect.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.6
* JIRA 7.1.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between Confluence and JIRA
# Create a project (e.g. test) and an issue (e.g. TEST-1) on JIRA
# Create a page on Confluence and set JIRA Chart Macro and configure a filter (e.g. {{project = test}}) on the page
# Click a link in the chart as follows
 !jira_chart.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Move to *JIRA Issue Search* page with some filter and there should be no error on the page

h3. Actual Results
Move to *JIRA Issue Search* page with the condition that no filter was set and an error was shown on the page
 !jira_filter.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This problem never happen on any other link in the chart aside from the one mentioned above. It looks like the final column is just summing all the items up instead of referring to a JIRA filter as shown in the screenshot:

!jira_chart_macro.png|thumbnail!

You'll see the URL is showing {{filter=null}}.
fields.summary: Link in JIRA Chart (Two dimensional) is incorrect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41037].
  {panel}

When using [Content by Label Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/content-by-label-macro-145566.html], we can set *Maximum number of pages*.
However, even if we set more than 500 pages as *Maximum number of pages* in the macro on a page, only 500 pages can be shown on the page at most.
(*"500"* seems to be the "real" limit regardless of *Maximum number of pages*.)

Then, could you add the above information about the "real" limit of *Maximum number of pages* to [the document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/content-by-label-macro-145566.html]?
fields.summary: How many pages can be shown on a page at most with Content by Label Macro?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41036].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Date picker should be searchable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a date picker on a page
 !date.png|thumbnail! 
# Search the page with using some keywords ("14", "Mar", "2016") for the date you picked on the step 1

h3. Expected Results
The page should be searchable.

h3. Actual Results
The page wasn't show as a result of the searching.
fields.summary: Date picker should be searchable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41035].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Using Chrome 50, Confluence editor will render half its height, causing UI usability problems, see the screenshot: 
!image-2016-03-13-08-59-03-220.png|thumbnail! 

Normally, the button bar would appear at the bottom of the browser, and the editor would take the full height. It works fine in Chrome 49 stable release and other browsers.

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Install Chrome 50.x
# Open Confluence and edit a page

h5. Cause
The affected version of Chrome introduced the following bug that is related to the issue: [display: table-row; doesn't work with height: 100%;	|https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=594376].

h4. Workaround
Apply the following stylesheet to Confluence Admin > Custom HTML > At end of the HEAD
{code}
<style type="text/css">
#content.edit
{ display: table-cell; }
</style>
{code}

Note: If the workaround appears to revert after a restart, but the custom HTML is still present, verify that there are no space level customizations in the affected area.

h4. Resolution
Upgrade to a release that contains the fix (Confluence 5.9.7 or higher).

fields.description:
We would like to upgrade from Confluence 5.8.10 to Confluence 5.9.x, but so far we find the re-indexing performance intolerable.  Our Prod instance is at 5.8.10 and we have 3 test instances.  One at 5.8.10, one at 5.8.18 and one at 5.9.6.  We are using MySQL 5.5.22 for all and the test instances are all on the same server.

The two 5.8.x test instances change reindex 32K objects in about 15 minutes.  We  have tried 5.9.3 and now 5.9.6 for our 3rd test instance and both 5.9.3 and 5.9.6 take just under 4 hours to rebuild the same 32K objects.  

We were hopeful that the fix mentioned in CONF-40544 and part of 5.9.5 would correct our situation, but it appears to have done nothing for the problem.  We will not be able to keep Confluence current until this is resolved.
fields.summary: Slow reindexing since Confluence 5.9.x with MySQL 5.5.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41014].
  {panel}

This wouldn't often be recommended, but these values can be altered to trade off the potential for data integrity issues in favour of uptime, or vice versa.

To set the Hazelcast heartbeat to 60s (for example): Add the JVM parameter {{-Dconfluence.cluster.hazelcast.max.no.heartbeat.seconds=60}}

To modify the Cluster Safety interval or disable the job entirely: {{Admin > Scheduled jobs}}

h3. How these two settings operate
Hazelcast is Confluence's distributed caching mechanism. Data will be stored in the cache on one node only, and when other nodes want that data, they contact the node that has it. If no node has it, they query the database. Hazelcast controls the cluster membership. If a node has not communicated with the other nodes in the cluster for the heartbeat period (30s by default), the other nodes will remove it from the cluster. It will then not be able to contact the shared cache until it has successfully rejoined the cluster.

[Cluster safety|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Recovering+from+a+Data+Center+cluster+split-brain] is a scheduled job that runs on each node in a cluster, every 30s by default. It compares a number in Hazelcast's cache to a number in the database. If the numbers differ, the node will throw a panic event and stop processing. It is intended to ensure that all nodes that are able to communicate with the database, are also communicating with Hazelcast's shared cache, to avoid writing out of date data to the database, and overwriting more recent edits.

h3. Some example configurations
h5. Uptime over data integrity
* Change both to 1 minute - this would mean you could have network interruptions or GC pauses up to 1 minute without triggering cluster panics. However, in the rare case that two nodes are no longer communicating, there would be a maximum of a 1 minute interval where the data on each node may be out of sync, and this could cause conflicting data to be written to the database.
* Leaving the hazelcast timeout at 30 seconds and cluster safety to 10 minutes would allow nodes to be evicted from and rejoin the cluster (eg after a 30s GC or network blip), without a cluster panic occurring. This would mean that the cluster could potentially operate in a 'split brain' scenario where the nodes do not rejoin, for up to 10 minutes before throwing a panic. However, it would give evicted nodes a lot more time to rejoin the cluster gracefully after eviction.

h5. Data integrity over uptime
* Change both to 15 seconds - this sacrifices uptime for more confidence around data integrity. It means a maximum of 15 seconds where nodes could be out of communication with each other and still writing to the database. It could mean that GCs and network blips over 15 seconds will trigger a cluster panic, so you would run the risk of having more outages.
* Change the hazelcast timeout to 1 minute and the cluster safety job to 15 seconds - this would mean GCs etc could run for up to 1 minute without nodes being evicted from the cluster. However, once they are evicted, the time they could potentially write to the database is lowered to 15 seconds.
fields.summary: Allow cluster safety and hazelcast heartbeat intervals to be configurable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The addition of the index {{c_status_idx}} on the column {{content_status}} in the Table {{CONTENT}} in Confluence 5.8 and 5.9 causes content index administration (rebuilding the Content Index) to be come dramatically slower than previous indexing. Clients experiencing this issue will see as much as a 10x slower speed in overall content index administration. This does not now appear to be solely related to Oracle, thus the need to *update* this issue.

When Confluence is running on *any database*, query speed from the above SQL query can return up to 10x slower when using this table index, which causes overall Confluence search index rebuild speed to become dramatically slower. In one observed Confluence instance with 8 million pieces of content (1.5 million of which is current), the search index rebuild time went from 4 hours in Confluence 5.7 to 30+ hours in 5.8 when running Oracle. In an instance running Microsoft SQL Server with Confluence 5.9.x, the indexing went from 3 to 4 hours up to 9 to 12 hours. In another instance running PostgreSQL, the indexing went from 3 hours to 8 to 10 hours. Similar reports have been made about MySQL, and given the facts of the index's low cardinality (only two possible values exist: current or deleted), it would make sense to remove this index to improve performance.

h3. Environments
Confirmed in Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle databases. Not confirmed yet for PostgreSQL, not confirmed in MySQL, though there are numerous slow indexing issues in MySQL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Any Confluence instance with content _at scale_ is likely to experience this issue on Confluence 5.8 or 5.9. An instance with more than 250000 pages should be sufficient to expose the issue
# Build an instance at scale with 250,000 pages and deploy on Confluence 5.7.4 or greater
# Rebuild the Content Index using the UI
# Observe the time to index
# Upgrade the instance to Confluence 5.9
# Rebuild the Content Index using the UI
# Observe the much slower time to index the content

h3. Expected Results
I would expect no difference to indexing performance at a minimum, and with the improved performance of the application, I would expect performance to include improvements in indexing speed.

h3. Actual Results
The indexing is actually much slower, causing much frustration on the part of clients, as the index rebuild is far _*slower*_ than it was before the upgrade to Confluence. 

h3. Notes
In Confluence 5.8, a table index was added onto the {{content_status}} column of the {{CONTENT}} table called {{c_status_idx}}. This index is used in the following SQL query frequently when Confluence's search index is being rebuilt:
{code:sql}
select confluence1_.user_key as user_key0_, confluence1_.user_key as user_key1_, confluence1_.username as username0_, confluence1_.lower_username as lower_us3_0_, confluence1_.username as username1_, confluence1_.lower_username as lower_us3_1_, contentent0_.CONTENTID as x0_0_, contentent0_.VERSION as x1_0_, confluence1_.user_key as x2_0_, contentent0_.LASTMODDATE as x3_0_, contentent0_.VERSIONCOMMENT as x4_0_ from CONTENT contentent0_ left outer join user_mapping confluence1_ on contentent0_.LASTMODIFIER=confluence1_.user_key where (contentent0_.PREVVER=? )or(contentent0_.CONTENTID=? )and(contentent0_.CONTENT_STATUS='current' ) order by  contentent0_.VERSION desc
{code}

Particularly, it is due to this section of the query, which was not present during index rebuild for the 5.7 or prior Confluence versions:
{code}
contentent0_.CONTENT_STATUS='current' 
{code}

We know that the table index is at play, because if we give a [NO_INDEX|https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B12037_01/server.101/b10752/hintsref.htm#29911] hint to Oracle while running the above query, which explicitly asks the DB not to use the index on {{c_status_idx}}, the results return very swiftly, e.g.:
{code:sql}
select /*+ NO_INDEX(contentent0_ c_status_idx) */ confluence1_.user_key as user_key0_, confluence1_.user_key as user_key1_, confluence1_.username as username0_, confluence1_.lower_username as lower_us3_0_, confluence1_.username as username1_, confluence1_.lower_username as lower_us3_1_, contentent0_.CONTENTID as x0_0_, contentent0_.VERSION as x1_0_, confluence1_.user_key as x2_0_, contentent0_.LASTMODDATE as x3_0_, contentent0_.VERSIONCOMMENT as x4_0_ from CONTENT contentent0_ left outer join user_mapping confluence1_ on contentent0_.LASTMODIFIER=confluence1_.user_key where (contentent0_.PREVVER=949 )or(contentent0_.CONTENTID=949 )and(contentent0_.CONTENT_STATUS='current' ) order by  contentent0_.VERSION desc
{code}

The column "content_status" is responsible for tracking whether a page is current, or deleted and sitting in a Space's trash. There are only two possible values for this column: "current" or "deleted". Due to the low cardinality, and that the vast majority of the values are "current", it may not make sense that we have a b-tree table index on this column (especially if it can negatively impact performance).

h3. Workaround
(!) *PLEASE READ*:  It is recommended  that you follow best practices for Change Management and will *test and validate* these settings in a Test/Development and Staging environment *prior to* rolling any changes into a Production environment. You *must* test and validate these changes to insure that they will function will within your infrastructure prior to placing these changes in production.

If you suspect that you are impacted by this issue, you should test and evaluate dropping the index on the {{content_status}} column of the {{CONTENT}} table in a Test or development instance, then test the search index rebuild speed. You may need to restart your instance *before* you retest the Content Index Rebuild to verify the performance improvement.
fields.summary: Table index "c_status_idx" on CONTENT.content_status can cause slow search index rebuilding

*Situation 1: Saving manually*
- Create a confluence page
- (OSX) hold CRTL and CMD and then press the Space bar
- Choose an unusual emoji (such as the one in the screenshot attached to this issue)
- Press the save button, which will result in the error that I have attached to this issue as well

*Situation 2: Saving automatically*
(This is what killed our Confluence instance last week)
- Create a confluence page and add an 'unusual' emoji
- Wait for the auto-save feature to kick in

In my case, I left the window open while I was working on something else. The auto-save feature tried to save the page over and over again. Our confluence page became unusable and we had to restart it.

We tried to recreate both situations on our acceptance instance of Confluence. Situation 1 was easily recreated. But situation 2 didn't bring Confluence down this time. It might be that we didn't leave the window open long enough.
fields.summary: Adding 'unusual' Emoji result in a System Error and might be able to take down Confluence

fields.description:
Bob Swift's SQL Macro is loading slowly and timing out. This is due to the rendering order of macros - in the past, nested macros would render after their parent macros. In 5.9.5 however this appears to have changed, and the inner macros are rendered first. This is negating the benefits of using the Cache, Future and Run macros to wrap slow SQL macros.

h4. Input:
Future -> Cache -> SQL

h4. New rendering flow:
SQL -> Cache -> SQL -> Future -> Cache -> SQL

h4. Old rendering flow:
Future -> Cache -> SQL
fields.summary: Loading pages with SQL macro are slower than normal and timeout more frequently

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As a Confluence administrator, if we choose to *Edit Details* on a disabled user account, the account becomes re-enabled leading to license count and security issues.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user in the *Add Users* tab in the *Users* section of the admin console
# Disable the user and confirm it
# Enter the user account again, and choose *Edit Details* 
# Doing anything (including just selecting submit) will cause the account to be re-enabled (only cancel will prevent this from happening).   

h3. Expected Results
We would expect that you can edit the account however you like, but that it would stay disabled after the changes have been made

h3. Actual Results
The account is automatically re-enabled

h3.Solution / Workaround
The only workaround right now is to ensure that you disable the account again after editing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User that are authenticated by second user directory appears to be logged in under the first user directory

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.7 and above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Confluence connected to a JIRA user directory
# Put JIRA user directory in the highest position
# Have a user that exists in both Confluence Internal Directory and in JIRA user directory (for example, "admin")
# Make sure that both these users have different password
#* For example, password: "admin" for JIRA user directory and "admin1" for Confluence Internal Directory
# Login to Confluence using the account that belongs from the Confluence Internal Directory (2nd position)

h3. Expected Results
Either:
# User is not able to log in, or
# User able to log in, and Confluence register this user to be from the Confluence Internal Directory

h3. Actual Results
# User able to log in and is registered to be logged in from JIRA user directory
 
h3. Notes
While this behavior is great and serves as a failover, this will lead to confusion to admins as admins are not able to know for sure on which user directory the authentication takes place. For example:

# Confluence has JIRA and Confluence internal user directory. 
#* Jira user directory is placed at the highest position
#* Both JIRA and Confluence internal has the user "admin"
# For some reason, JIRA user directory is not working
# Log in to Confluence using the user account "admin"
# Logging in is successful. Which means the authentication takes place in the Confluence Internal Directory
# Go to Confluence Admin > User Directory. User will be unable to make changes in JIRA user directory as it seems like user is logged in under the first user directory
fields.summary: Users that are authenticated by second user directory appears to be logged in under the first user directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40988].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a page has one macro within another macro, let's say a Warning macro within an Info macro, and at least 2 users are editing this page at the same time, and both users save the page, the macro within breaks after the second user saves the page, see screenshot.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add an Info macro and within the Info macro add a Warning macro
# Save the page
# With one user, edit the page
# Access this page with another user and also edit the page
# While both users are editing the page at the same time the first user saves the page, and the second user also saves the page right after

h3. Expected Results
After the second user saves the page, the macro within the other macro, on this case the Warning macro, should still be viewable
h3. Actual Results
The macro within the other macro breaks. A message saying "Broken macro" is displayed
 
h3. Notes
There's no need for both users to save the page at the exact same time (instantaneously).

h3.Workaround
As a workaround, when a User edits the problem page, the user can add an edit restriction for the page and restrict editing to themselves. This restoration will need to be removed after editing the page. This is a rather tedious workaround, but it will prevent the issue until the problem is resolved.

*NB: In the unlikely event that anyone experiences this issue post 5.10.4, it is because the macros were entered on the page some time ago, before macro ids were used. If this does occur, the workaround is to revert to the old version, then save the page (ensuring no one else is editing it at the same time). Once a single-session save has occurred, the macro will have an id, and the problem will be solved for that page forever.*
fields.summary: Macro within another macro is broken after the second user saves the page

fields.description:
During the migration of Confluence from a server to another server I faced the following errors, and managed to resolve them dropping a table and a sequence.

h2. Migration process applied
- export full XML backup from source installation + data directory
- install  confluence on new server
- import source backup in new confluence using normal import tool

h2. Error / Issue description

* After migrating, no plugin would not update (the "update" box is shown and either the progress bar would get stuck or finish correctly, but after a full Confluence stop/start it would show that the plugin is still in the same version).

* In the log, I identified 2 oracle errors : ORA-01400 (regarding the table) and ORA-00955 (regarding the sequence associated to this table).

* The table identified by ORA-01400 was empty.

h2. Solution applied

* Look in the logs and identify the Table and it's Sequence (look for ORA-00955 error for the Sequence number) . 

* Stop confluence
* Drop the culprit table & sequence :
{noformat}
select * from AO_6384AB_FEATURE_METADATA_AO

DROP TABLE AO_6384AB_FEATURE_METADATA_AO;
DROP SEQUENCE AO_6384AB_FEATURE_M675681913;
COMMIT;
{noformat}
* Start confluence
* Check :
     ** if logs still show the same error
     ** if Confluence filled correctly the table after the restart
     ** if plugins update correctly

h2. Error logs
h3. ERROR : ORA-01400

The culprit table is empty and needs to be reconstructed.

{noformat}
2016-03-02 11:25:07,717 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher] run There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event [com.atlassian.config.lifecycle.events.ApplicationStartedEvent@407a742d] from the invoker [SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker{method=public void com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.featurediscovery.PluginModuleEventListener.onApplicationStart(com.atlassian.config.lifecycle.events.ApplicationStartedEvent), listener=com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.featurediscovery.PluginModuleEventListener@1cc7b1ba}]
java.lang.RuntimeException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
    - name:Oracle
    - version:Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.2.0 - 64bit Production
With the Partitioning, OLAP, Advanced Analytics and Real Application Testing options
    - minor version:1
    - major version:12
Driver:
    - name:Oracle JDBC driver
    - version:12.1.0.2.0

java.sql.SQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException: ORA-01400: cannot insert NULL into ("CONFPROD"."AO_6384AB_FEATURE_METADATA_AO"."ID")

    at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:54)
    at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$1$1.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:48)
    at com.google.common.util.concurrent.MoreExecutors$SameThreadExecutorService.execute(MoreExecutors.java:253)
    at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.dispatch(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:107)
    at com.atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl.invokeListeners(EventPublisherImpl.java:160)
    at com.atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl.publish(EventPublisherImpl.java:79)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.event.TimingEventPublisher.publish(TimingEventPublisher.java:73)
    at com.atlassian.config.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleManager.startUp(DefaultLifecycleManager.java:43)
    at com.atlassian.config.lifecycle.LifecycleServletContextListener.contextInitialized(LifecycleServletContextListener.java:17)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:4973)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.startInternal(StandardContext.java:5467)
    at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:150)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1559)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1549)

Caused by: com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:

{noformat}

And the sequence error :
{noformat}
2016-03-03 09:50:30,209 ERROR [active-objects-init-system tenant-0] [net.java.ao.sql] handleUpdateError Exception executing SQL update <CREATE SEQUENCE "AO_6384AB_FEATURE_M675681913" INCREMENT BY 1 START WITH 1 NOMAXVALUE MINVALUE 1>

h2. References
this solution was inspired by the following 2 pages :
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/unable-to-install-add-ons-in-upm-due-to-duplicate-key-value-in-ao_6384ab_feature_metadata-table-741999240.html

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/comments-and-likes-fail-with-internal-server-error-319390100.html

fields.description:
Currently, email notifications are properly blocked by permissions checks in two differing scenarios, but are throwing an ERROR in the Confluence logs. This adds a level of Noise to the logging which is not necessary. Ideally, the ERROR message would not exist, as the application is behaving correctly and does not send the email notification. The issue is that it throws an ERROR message when none should occur in the instance.

h4. Scenario One
# In the first case, 'User A' is granted access to a Space and allowed to add a watch on the entire 'Q' space.
# After the user has an established watch, 'Space Admin B' restricts the users that can see the s'Q' space.
# 'User A' is no longer allowed to view or access the 'Q' space.
# Another user - let's say 'User C', updates the 'Q' space - whether adding an attachment, editing a page or making a blogpost in the instance.
# Confluence then attempts to send an email notification to 'User A' - and this is properly denied, but the application also throws an ERROR message in the logs, when in reality, the application has not incurred an ERROR, as the application properly did not send due to the page restrictions in place. 

h4. Scenario Two
# 'User A' has a Space watch on 'X' Space
# 'Space Admin B' restricts a single page or set of pages in 'X' space
# Users update the restricted page(s), adding content, attachments and making comments
# Confluence then attempts to send an email notification to 'User A' - and this is properly denied, but the application also throws an ERROR message in the logs, when in reality, the application has not incurred an ERROR, as the application properly did not send due to the page restrictions in place. 

h4. Functional Impact
In a large, enterprise-scale environment, Operations Teams must investigate the ERROR messages and this adds to their workload. This causes extra work for Confluence Administrators when grepping their logs for signs of trouble, as the message is shown as an ERROR. This causes confusion and extra noise in the logs.

Clients have reported that they would prefer for the message not to be thrown as an ERROR in the instance, as the system is properly denying the outbound notification based upon the settings of the page permissions. Therefore, it is not able to send due to the inherent page permission restrictions, and is not truly an ERROR, but is acting correctly based on the permissions. It is desired that the page permissions check occur, and if the permissions do not allow notification, simply do not send without logging an improper ERROR message and stack trace to reduce the noise in logs.

h4. Desired Change
Check permissions for user prior to sending email. Bail out if email notification is not authorized for the content that has been changed.
fields.summary: Space Watch emails should not be sent and no ERROR recorded for proper permissions check

fields.description:
We ran into a redirect loop related to an issue with JIRA directory synchronization (see linked).

Our confluence instance references JIRA for user directory. When we moved a group containing users used for user filter into a sub-OU from the current, JIRA considered it new and deleted the users and re-added them. In doing so, Confluence removed them because they were considered "inactive".

The redirect loop is apparent when a user whom was already logged in attempted to browse to Confluence. Their user was not present resulting in a redirect to the login page. The login page saw the token and attempted to authenticate the user.

The solution was to start a new session (incognito or another browser) and log in normally. Confluence re-added their user to the users list after checking JIRA for authentiation.
fields.summary: Redirect Loop as a result of AD group change w/ JIRA as Source

fields.description:
h3. Summary

h3. Environment
Confluence 5.9.5 with Firefox 44.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence
# Open Firefox
# Go to *about:cache* in the address bar
# Got to *List Cache Entries*
# Go to the Confluence login page and notice the number of cached entries increases
# Refresh the page multiple times to simulate page navigations without any changes
# Notice the List of Cached Entries increases every time and the size of the cached content
#  Since the expiration for these files is either 1969-12-31 18:00:00 or in the future, these files will remain in cache until the browser is completely closed. This can cause issues if users do not close the browser as file entries will continue to grow, affecting disk size and local performance eventually. 

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should not be caching information for pages that have not changed, seemingly by time stamp.


h3. Actual Results
Files continue to be cached KB's a time until size becomes a factor.
 

h3.Workaround
# Use Firefox in Private Mode to avoid caching
# Set cache limits in Firefox (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/758031) to avoid performance impacts
# Close browser completely so that cache can be cleared (default setting)
fields.summary: Firefox cached content for Confluence increasing without changes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When upgrading Confluence to a version with an updated Tomcat version, the installer does not update the Windows service. The customers have to update the service via the registry or service.bat.
h3. Suggested Solution
Update the installer so it reinstalls the service.
h3. Workaround 1
Remove and reinstall via service.bat as in this document:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/start-confluence-automatically-on-windows-as-a-service-172071.html
h3. Workaround 2
{panel}

(!) _Incorrectly modifying the Windows Registry could leave your Windows computer inoperable - always ensure that you have a backup of your registry before making any changes._

# Start -> Run -> Type "regedit.exe" and click OK
# Browse to {{HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\}} and look for the key that starts with "Confluence"
#* _In one instance, the key was labelled as Confluence01051465235_
# Double click the "ImagePath" value
# In the text box, replace {{tomcat7.exe}} with {{tomcat8.exe}}. For example:

{code}
"C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence\bin\tomcat7.exe" //RS//Confluence010514165235
{code}

becomes 

{code}"C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence\bin\tomcat8.exe" //RS//Confluence010514165235{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40958].
  {panel}

Suggestion CONF-19116 was recently implemented which drastically impacted the way we utilize Confluence.  Rather than hard coding what the people directory should display it would be appreciated if this "Can Use" filter be moved to an enable/disable option, or allow custom filtering.

Some examples on what this suggestion impacted for us:
Prior to this change, we would utilize the People Directory along with the User Profiles for Confluence Add-on to display a company directory (Based on Active Directory user directory settings) to our visitors.  Our entire user staff does not have a need to have "can use" functionality for Confluence, so this change now limits what is displayed to our end users which is currently only a handful of users.

Prior to this change we would utilize ConfiForms with a "User" field definition in order for our IT/Management team to log events relating to company staff (Again, not all staff have/need "Can Use" functionality).  Using this field type was a big benefit as it allowed us to tie into Active Directory to ensure names are typed correctly, as well as pulling in additional info if needed (Photos, e-mail addresses, phone #'s and etc).  This change eliminated this functionality as not all users were displayed, so we had to change this to a text field which limits functionality.
fields.summary: Create an option to determine what People Directory should display

fields.description:
Since Confluence 5.8.x, the URL parameter {{&labelsString=}} is not working anymore for the following actions:

* createpage
* createblogpost
* createpage-entervariables

This issue is related to CONF-37848 but in our case it effect more actions as mentioned above. Also, the suggested workaround doesn't work for us.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40952].
  {panel}

h3. Steps To Reproduce

# Click ...
# Filter for "Sprint Plan"
# double click Sprint plan
# clear filter field
# Filter for "Sprint Plan"
# hit enter
# hit enter repeatedly

+Expected+
A sprint plan in the editor view

+Actual+
Multiple spinners in the bottom right of the Create dialog (see attached)

h3. Workaround
Disable the {{Sprint plan(jira-sprints-item)}} module of the Confluence Software Blueprints add-on, and flush the cache.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40946].
  {panel}

When navigating to a non-existent space in which the Home page has the same title as the Home page of an existing space, Confluence will return a "Page not found" page and also throw an IllegalArgumentException in the logs. 

Instead of filling up the logs with such exceptions, it would better to somehow intercept the request to prevent the exception, perhaps by first validating the space key in the request, yet still present the page not found to the user. 

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a new space: Office Space
# By default, a home page titled "Office Space Home" will be created
# Navigate to that home page
# In the browser's address bar, change the space key to a non-existent key
# The UI will display the "Page not found" page, and an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown in the logs:
\\

fields.summary: Improve handling of "Page not found" exceptions

fields.description:
h3. Context

We have Confluence running with SSO from Crowd. Confluence is behind a corporate reverse proxy (from BlueCoat) which has caching enabled but respects the Cache-control, Expire and Pragma HTTP headers.

h3. Problem

We have discovered following cases of sessions mix up where a user \[1] get the Crowd token cookie value from another user \[2] and then user \[1] can make actions in Confluence as if logged in with user \[2] credentials.

h3. Details

After some investigation, we discovered that Confluence, if

# a user with no Confluence session
# with a valid Crowd session
# tries to get some Confluence pages
# will get Confluence responses which have:

* no Cache-Control headers
* have Set-Cookie: crowd.token_key headers

This behavior is dangerous as some Confluence resources can be cached by the upstream reverse proxy with Set-Cookie headers; and they can be served as cached data to other users.

h3. Workaround

On the reverse proxy, disabling caching completely or selectively on responses containing Set-Cookie headers


h3. Real fix

Confluence setting Cache-Control header whenever Confluence sends Set-Cookie headers

Same as BSERV-8483, JRA-60043, BAM-17294
fields.summary: Responses with Set-Cookie header cached

fields.description:
h3. *Steps to reproduce*
# Set your computer timezone to GMT+0.
# Create a page in Confluence. Notice that in the dashboard under "Recently worked on", the page shows under "today"
# Change your computer timezone to GMT-7
# Notice that the page in the "Recently worked on" dashboard shows "yesterday"
# Create a new page and notice that the new page also shows "yesterday".

Things to note:
- Index rebuild from scratch doesn't help (x)
- Changing the user's personal timezone to GMT-7 doesn't help (x)
- If a different user changes his computer timezone (not server's timezone), the problem persists (x)
- *Even if a new user with a different timezone (GMT-7) than the server's timezone signs up and creates a new content. It is shown as "Yesterday"* (x)

This issue is important for Confluence with users from different timezones.
This can cause confusion among users.

Before timezone change :
 !gmt+8.PNG|thumbnail! 

After timezone change:
 !gmt-7.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Summary
JIRA Issue Macro will not display when it's added in table header

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create table in any Confluence page
# Insert JIRA Issue/filter macro into table header (link it to any issue)

h3. Expected Results
* The JIRA Issue Macro should display properly.

h3. Actual Results
* The JIRA Issue Macro display with an error _Getting issue details_
*  !jira filter.jpg|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
What's interesting - it works properly in page preview, the problem appears only after the page save.

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate*
# Create a page with text and code block macro.
# Save the page.
# Copy the text and Code block macro in the page *View* mode.
# Edit other page and paste the copied text and code block macro.
# Save the edited page.

*Expected Result*
The code block macro will be pasted correctly with the formatting.

*Actual result*
Only the code inside the code block macro is visible when viewing the edited page.

*Diagnosis*
Edit the edited page by removing the pasted code block macro and create the new table at the same area and save the page. You will notice that the table formatting will break in the page "View" mode.
fields.summary: Confluence copying Code Block Macro in view mode breaks text formatting when pasted into page editor.

Cheers,

Adam Barnes - Confluence Product Manager

  {panel}

It would be more convenience if we could improve the comparison dialog (refer attachment in the support ticket) for concurrent editing so that user will notice that they may need to scroll down the dialogue to see the changes.

Below are the improvement request:
Perhaps will be enough to change the information note at the top. 

Currently it display:
*Sorry, your changes cannot be merged automatically.*
Suggestion:
*Sorry, your changes cannot be merged automatically. Review the changes by scrolling down this dialogue at the top.*

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When installed on Solaris, Confluence will fail to render files in the new file previewer.

h3. Environment
* Solaris

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence on a machine running Solaris
# Attach a Powerpoint document onto a page
# Use the new file previewer to display the document on the page

h3. Expected Results
The file previewer renders the attached file

h3. Actual Results
The UI prompts the user to Download the file:
!Confl_preview_error.JPG!

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40918].
  {panel}

Hi,

There is a display bug on the backlog view that started manifesting about 10 days ago.

In short, the rows are displayed in double their height even though there are no extra elements on the cell. After reloading the page everything seems to go back to normal as shown on this video:
http://screencast.com/t/fCsDTnZFU2EQ
fields.summary: Backlog view has display bug
